item.title: Light has been out for over three weeks., 23rd October
item.description:
This light is outside 95 Springbank Rd. It has been out for three weeks. How much more longer do we have to wait. So will I have to go to the press? You could report a light and it would be repaired with promptly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Springbank Road, Springbank, Cheltenham

item.title: At around dusk on 6.30pm on 24/09/24 my front nearside tyre hit a 10 inch porhole that looked like a pool of water on B4063 heading west towards Churchdown. I stopped the car and went back to check and realised it was a pothole not a puddle. On 26/09/24 I noticed a bulge on the tyre wall so took it to Tyre City and they confirmed that it was pothole damage so I had to buy a new tyre and have the tracking adjusted, I have the invoice which I can send to you if required.ce, 23rd October
item.description:

item.title: Branches overhanging my property are being used for roosting crows who are dedicating all over my drive and car. Not only is their excrement damaging my card osinteork, there is a health hazard stepping and walking through it. The pictures are just one days worth of fouling., 23rd October

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 23rd October
item.description:
Overgrown Tree at property number 81 Brookfield Rd has caused extensive damage to the FW as a result I am raising a defect on the FW for a large patch to cover root damage. I have also hand delivered a 1st tree letter requesting that the overhanging branches onto the CW and FW be cut back. Owner refuses to have any work carried out. Can this be passed on to the local AHR for the area to investigate further aside from sending the tree letter there is very little else I can do to force him to cut it down. I consider it a danger to other members of the public and school nearby.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle path reduced to approximately 20cm width by overgrown grass verge., 23rd October
item.description:
Cycle path near Bleasby Gds drastically reduced to approximately 20cm width by significantly overgrown grass verge. The result is cyclists are forced to encroach on the space designated for the more vulnerable pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Lansdown Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
